Answers.prompt: I am an American high school student that received the following question. Please answer it as a student would do. Censorship in the Libraries. ‘All of us can think of a book that we hope none of our children or any other children have taken off the shelf. But if I have the right to remove that book from the shelf -- that work I abhor -- then you also have exactly the same right and so does everyone else. And then we have no books left on the shelf for any of us.’ --Katherine Paterson, Author. Write a persuasive essay to a newspaper reflecting your views on censorship in libraries. Do you believe that certain materials, such as books, music, movies, magazines, etc., should be removed from the shelves if they are found offensive? Support your position with convincing arguments from your own experience, observations, and/or reading.
Answers.answer: Dear Editor,  As a high school student who is part of the generation that has grown up surrounded by technology, I strongly believe that computers have a positive impact on people and society as a whole. While some may argue that excessive computer use can lead to negative consequences, I believe that the benefits far outweigh the drawbacks.  Computers play a crucial role in education by providing access to a wealth of information and resources that were previously unavailable. They enable students to learn about faraway places, different cultures, and diverse perspectives, broadening their horizons and enhancing their understanding of the world. Additionally, computers improve hand-eye coordination through interactive games and simulations, honing valuable skills that are relevant in today's digital age.  Moreover, computers have revolutionized communication by enabling people to connect with others from around the globe. Social media platforms and online messaging services have brought people closer together, facilitating the exchange of ideas, fostering friendships, and even bridging cultural divides. In a world that is increasingly interconnected, computers serve as a powerful tool for building relationships and fostering understanding among individuals with diverse backgrounds.  While it is important to acknowledge concerns about excessive screen time and its potential impact on physical health and social interactions, I believe that the key lies in striking a balance. By using computers in moderation and incorporating physical activity, outdoor experiences, and quality time with family and friends into our daily routines, we can enjoy the benefits of technology without compromising our well-being.  In conclusion, computers have brought about countless opportunities for learning, communication, and personal growth. Rather than viewing them as a hindrance, we should embrace their potential to enrich our lives and enhance our connections with the world. I urge readers to consider the positive impact of computers on society and to approach technology with an open mind and a balanced perspective.  Sincerely,  [Your Name] [American High School Student]

While it is true that computers provide many benefits such as improving hand-eye coordination, facilitating learning about different cultures, and enabling online communication, I am concerned about the negative impact they may have on people.  In today's digital age, it is easy to become consumed by the virtual world that computers offer. Many individuals, especially young people like myself, spend countless hours in front of screens, which can lead to a sedentary lifestyle. Instead of engaging in physical activities, enjoying nature, and interacting face-to-face with loved ones, people are often glued to their devices.  We must strike a balance between utilizing the benefits of technology and ensuring that we do not neglect our physical and social well-being. Encouraging moderation in computer usage is key to maintaining a healthy lifestyle. By limiting screen time, we can prioritize activities that promote physical fitness, mental well-being, and meaningful relationships.  I urge my fellow community members to reflect on their computer usage habits and consider the importance of finding a healthy equilibrium between virtual interactions and real-life experiences. Let us embrace technology as a tool for learning and connectivity, but not at the expense of our overall health and social connections.  Thank you for considering my perspective on this important issue.  Sincerely,  [Your Name] High School Student

But if I have the right to remove that book from the shelf -- that work I abhor -- then you also have exactly the same right and so does everyone else. And then we have no books left on the shelf for any of us.’ --Katherine Paterson, Author. Write a persuasive essay to a newspaper reflecting your views on censorship in libraries. Do you believe that certain materials, such as books, music, movies, magazines, etc., should be removed from the shelves if they are found offensive? Support your position with convincing arguments from your own experience, observations, and/or reading.
Answers.answer: Dear Editor,  As a high school student, I have witnessed firsthand the increasing role that computers play in our daily lives. While some may argue that the pervasive use of computers may have negative effects on society, I firmly believe that the benefits far outweigh any drawbacks.  First and foremost, computers provide an invaluable tool for education and learning. With access to the internet, students like myself can explore faraway places, learn about different cultures, and engage with a wealth of educational resources that were previously unavailable. Additionally, computers help to improve hand-eye coordination through interactive games and activities, which can be both fun and educational.  Furthermore, computers enable us to connect with people from all around the world. Through online platforms, we can communicate, collaborate, and share ideas with individuals we may never have had the opportunity to meet otherwise. This fosters cultural understanding and can lead to valuable friendships and connections.  While it is true that some may express concerns about the amount of time we spend on our computers, I believe that moderation and balance are key. Just as with any tool, it is important to use computers responsibly and in conjunction with other activities such as exercise, nature exploration, and spending time with loved ones.  In conclusion, computers have had a profoundly positive impact on society, enriching our lives in countless ways. By embracing and utilizing this technology responsibly, we can harness its full potential to learn, connect, and grow together.  Thank you for considering my perspective.  Sincerely, [Your Name] High School Student

Answers.answer: Dear Editor,  I am writing to express my perspective on the impact that computers have on society. As a high school student who has grown up in the age of technology, I believe that computers provide numerous benefits to individuals and communities.  First and foremost, computers offer invaluable educational opportunities. Through online learning platforms and research tools, people can access information and knowledge from around the world with just a few clicks. This fosters intellectual growth and helps individuals develop a broader understanding of different cultures and perspectives.  Additionally, computers promote social connectivity. Social media platforms and messaging services allow people to communicate and stay connected with friends, family, and acquaintances regardless of geographic location. This is especially important in today's globalized world, where maintaining relationships across distances is increasingly commonplace.  Moreover, computers serve as a gateway to creativity and innovation. Whether through digital art, music production, programming, or writing, individuals can express themselves in ways that were previously unimaginable. This not only enriches the lives of creators but also contributes to the cultural richness of society as a whole.  While concerns about screen time and sedentary behavior are valid, it is essential to recognize that responsible use of computers can coexist with physical activity and face-to-face interactions. By promoting a balanced approach to technology use, individuals can enjoy the benefits of computers while also engaging in healthy lifestyle practices.  In conclusion, I firmly believe that computers have a positive impact on people and society as a whole. They offer educational, social, and creative opportunities that enhance our lives in meaningful ways. By harnessing the power of technology responsibly, we can maximize its benefits and create a more connected and enriched community.  Thank you for considering my perspective.  Sincerely, [Your Name]
